text:
Hi CMS React devs!

For those of you who use TypeScript, in v0.15.8 of `@HubSpot/cms-dev-server` we’ve added a new argument (`--generateFieldsTypes`) to the dev server that will automatically generate types based on the fields object you export in your modules, and watch for any updates made. This type file will be created in the same directory as your module and then you can then use it to type the `fieldValues` prop in your module component by including the new type as the generic of `ModuleProps<T>`.  To find out more, see <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/cms-dev-server.html#fields-type-generation|this entry in the docs> , and here’s a demo of this feature in action:
Once you create a section (part of a theme of a cms-react app) and then change its file name, the old section persists in HubSpot. is there a way to remove it?
This is probably the wrong channel but you can change the “name” of it to reset the section
theme was uploaded through cms-react, so I believe it's related
old and new sections both have the same label

I was wondering if this was on the roadmap to allow vite plugins?
> just as a note we don’t currently support developers adding in their own vite plugins but may in the future
I don't have an update on this.
<@UAYBXDG4U>, can we pin that ranking survery to the channel? I also didn’t know it existed, much less where to find it

I’m so excited for this!

Note: the docs have the “autogenerated file” comment in the fields.tsx file instead of fields.type.ts
Thank you! And nice catch, I’ve just put up a to fix for that and added a bit more complete example of the types we generate.
